title: Driven since Week 1 loss, red-hot Tide rout Vols
content: Playing with an "edge" since a Week 1 loss to Florida State, Alabama won its fourth straight game over a ranked team Saturday in a 37-20 victory over Tennessee.

title: Sources: Vols' Vitello favorite to land Giants job
content: The Giants have zeroed in on University of Tennessee baseball coach Tony Vitello for their managerial opening, sources confirmed to ESPN on Saturday.

title: Penn State loses interim's debut, 0-4 in Big Ten
content: Penn State fell to 3-4 -- and 0-4 in the Big Ten -- after blowing a late lead against Iowa in interim coach Terry Smith's first game since replacing James Franklin.

title: ASU stuns No. 7 TTU behind Leavitt's late magic
content: In a wild finish, Sam Leavitt came through for Arizona State on its final drive, leading the Sun Devils to the go-ahead touchdown with 34 seconds left to hand No. 7 Texas Tech its first loss of the season.

title: Messi scores hat trick to clinch MLS Golden Boot
content: Inter Miami captain Lionel Messi had a hat trick on the final day of MLS' regular season to clinch the 2025 MLS Golden Boot award.

title: Down time: Plane issue delays Packers for 5 hours
content: The plane carrying the Packers' players and coaches was delayed by more than five hours before leaving for Phoenix in advance of Sunday's game vs. the Cardinals.

title: Stockton fuels UGA's latest rally to topple Ole Miss
content: Gunner Stockton went 12-for-12 with three touchdowns in the second half, helping Georgia outscore Ole Miss 17-0 in the fourth quarter of Saturday's 43-35 win.

title: UAB, interim Mortensen shock No. 22 Memphis
content: UAB, with new interim coach Alex Mortensen and new starting QB Ryder Burton in charge, stunned No. 22 Memphis 31-24, clinching the win with a goal-line stand.

title: üèÄ 2025-26 BPI predictions for 23 NBA teams
content: The code is written. The simulations run. Here's who BPI projects to be in the top six in each conference, those fighting for play-in spots and three teams with high-variance young prospects.

content: We awarded nontraditional superlatives to programs, players and performances from across Week 8 of the 2025 college football season.

content: A 469-foot blast, a series-clinching gem on the same night? We got the full Ohtani October experience.

content: Should we expect a big day for the Bucs' receiving core? Can Quinshon Judkins go over 100 yards? And which AFC game could be low-scoring?

title: Our guide to every game: Matchup previews, predictions, picks and nuggets
content: Offense showdown in Bucs-Lions? Who wins Jayden Daniels vs. Dak Prescott? We have picks and predictions.

title: Jalen Hurts' passing game has fallen short of what the Eagles need
content: It's never a good idea to bet against the QB, but it's fair to say he hasn't gotten there yet this season.

title: 'He was a different dude': Looking back at Jim Harbaugh's career-best season with the 1995 Colts
content: This year marks the 30th anniversary of the 1995 Colts' magical run and Jim Harbaugh's best season as a quarterback.

title: Man City's Haaland shows why he's the best striker in the game right now
content: Saturday's win demonstrated what an elite striker can do for your team as Erling Haaland's goals lifted Man City to a comfy win. With such a dominate scorer in your team, there's always a chance.

content: Will Seattle's star receiver can keep up his impressive pace? Is a breakout game ahead for a Patriots rookie?

content: The Buccaneers have been hit particularly hard by injuries to receivers, but good news appears on the horizon.

content: We explore what has happened (good or bad) for seven particular teams -- and predict whether it'll continue.

title: üèà How Penn State unraveled under James Franklin
content: Penn State entered the season with national title aspirations. Six games in, the school fired its coach.

title: ‚ÜîÔ∏è Barnwell pitches 13 pre-deadline NFL trades
content: Jakobi Meyers to the NFC East? Trey Hendrickson and Jaelan Phillips to the same team? Russell Wilson to a contender? Let's build 13 win-win trades.

title: ‚öΩ Trump threatens to remove WC games from Boston
content: President Donald Trump threatened on Tuesday to revoke Boston's World Cup matches if local authorities don't get tougher on crime.

title: üò° Postgame fight mars Chiefs' win against Lions
content: A long, frustrating night for the Lions ended with safety Brian Branch delivering an open-handed strike to Chiefs wide receiver JuJu Smith-Schuster, setting off a brief fight among players from both teams.

title: üèÄ Cal: I'd retire before becoming 'transactional'
content: John Calipari has no plans to leave college basketball but said if he can no longer build relationships with players and do the job the way he wants, he'll exit the sport.

title: üî• Taking the temperature of NFL's hottest seats
content: Should the Dolphins or Ravens make coaching changes? Is it time for a QB switch for the Jets? Might the Eagles consider moves in their secondary?

title: Offseason questions for eliminated teams: What's next for Brewers after NLCS defeat
content: Here's how the winter looks in Milwaukee -- and in the other towns whose teams lost their final postseason game.

title: Week 7 betting guide: Saquon comes to life, Josh Jacobs keeps rolling
content: Our experts dive into the lines and player props that offer value for Week 7 and share their tips and bets.

title: Projecting four top-50 girls' fits at Duke, more top recruits
content: Breaking down the fits of every five-star commitment, including the fourth top-50 Blue Devils recruit for 2026-27.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Bayern aim to beat Liverpool to Gu√©hi
content: Liverpool face strong competition from Bayern Munich for Crystal Palace defender Marc Gu√©hi. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: 'No Kings' protests: Trump hits back with AI video of himself wearing crown, flying jet
content: President Donald Trump shared AI-generated videos and images on social media, depicting himself as a king and mocking "No Kings" protests. These demonstrations, organized against his "authoritarian agenda," saw millions participate nationwide. Trump's posts sparked debate, with some viewing them as humorous and others as ironic given the protest's message.

title: Back in time for Diwali: AI to bring back stranded Milan flyers; 256 set to return Sunday
content: Air India has scheduled a special flight on Sunday, October 19th, to bring 256 Delhi-bound passengers home from Milan in time for Diwali. The original flight, AI 138, was cancelled on October 17th due to a technical issue with the Boeing 787 Dreamliner. The airline has provided accommodation and meals to the stranded passengers.

title: Google DeepMind CEO warning on AI: Don't make mistake of Facebook, Instagram, and‚Ä¶.
content: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis warns that advanced AI systems exhibit "jagged intelligence," excelling in complex tasks like mathematical Olympiads while faltering on elementary problems. This inconsistency, stemming from missing reasoning and planning capabilities, poses a significant hurdle to achieving artificial general intelligence, requiring new benchmarks and methodologies to address.

title: Gaza truce falters: Hamas attacks Israeli troops in Rafah; IDF launches airstrikes
content: Two Israeli soldiers were injured in Tubas, West Bank, on Saturday evening when Palestinian fighters threw an explosive device at them during an IDF operation. The assailant escaped, and the soldiers were hospitalised. In response, the IDF reinforced its presence in Tubas and blocked town entrances.

title: Happy Diwali 2025: Best 50 messages, quotes, wishes, and images to share
content: Diwali 2025, on October 20th, promises a vibrant celebration of light, prosperity, and new beginnings. As families prepare for festivities, the article emphasizes the importance of sharing heartfelt messages and wishes to strengthen bonds. It offers a curated collection of greetings and practical tips to ensure your Diwali messages resonate deeply, spreading joy and connection across distances.

title: 'Make a deal': Putin makes war-end offer to Trump; what does he want from Ukraine?
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin has demanded full control of Donetsk from Ukraine as a condition to end the war, according to The Washington Post. This demand was reportedly made during a call with US President Donald Trump. While Putin offered concessions in Zaporizhzhia and Kherson, European diplomats dismissed the proposal as insignificant.

title: Upset Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang says: Our market share has fallen to Zero from 95% in ...
content: Nvidia's advanced AI chip dominance in China has evaporated, dropping to zero due to US export controls. CEO Jensen Huang revealed the company is completely barred from selling high-performance chips, warning this exclusion harms both nations and cedes the market to domestic rivals like Huawei.  China's push for self-sufficiency accelerates this shift.

title: China accuses US of cyberattack: Beijing says sensitive info stolen
content: China's Ministry of State Security accused the US NSA of conducting cyberattacks on its National Time Service Center, exploiting mobile messaging vulnerabilities to steal sensitive data. The ministry stated these attacks, using specialized tools, targeted critical timing systems and warned of potential disruptions to network communications, financial systems, and power supply.

title: End of an era: Calcutta Stock Exchange prepares for final Diwali
content: Kolkata's historic Calcutta Stock Exchange is preparing for a voluntary exit after a decade of legal battles, marking its last Kali Puja and Diwali as a working exchange. Trading was suspended in 2013. Shareholders approved the exit, and SEBI is now overseeing the valuation process.

title: Trump wants India to stop buying Russian oil ‚Äî but can it? Why crude imports can at best be reduced
content: Donald Trump claims India will cease Russian oil imports, a move PM Modi reportedly assured. However, India's significant reliance on discounted Russian crude, making up over a third of its supply, presents a complex challenge. Abruptly stopping these purchases is difficult due to existing contracts and economic advantages, potentially impacting global prices.

title: Massive shake-up at ScaleAI: Zuckerberg-backed firm lays off entire team
content: Scale AI has disbanded its Dallas-based New Projects Organization, a team of contractors focused on general AI chatbot improvement. This move, following a significant Meta investment, signals an industry pivot towards specialized, expert-level AI training in fields like medicine and robotics.  Affected workers received severance and were offered opportunities on Scale's gig platform.

title: Parineeti Chopra rushed to hospital in Delhi ahead of first child's delivery
content: Motherhood beckons for Parineeti Chopra as she has been admitted to a Delhi hospital for her delivery. The actress, who recently relocated to the capital with husband Raghav Chadha, is reportedly set to welcome their first child soon. Chadha has joined her at the hospital. The couple confirmed their pregnancy earlier this year.

title: 'Israel armed criminal militias': Is Hamas planning attack on Gaza civilians?
content: Hamas has strongly denied United States claims of the terror group planning attacks against civilians in Gaza. The Palestinian militant group stated these allegations are false and part of Israeli propaganda. Hamas asserts its police forces are protecting residents and holding militias accountable. Meanwhile, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu indicated the war will continue until Hamas is disarmed.

title: Muhurat Trading 2025: When NSE, BSE will open for special session? Date, time & more
content: India's stock markets are set for the symbolic Muhurat Trading session, marking the start of the new Hindu financial year, Samvat 2082. This one-hour special trading window, held on October 21, is observed for its auspicious beginnings and historical tendency for market gains, reflecting optimism for the year ahead.

title: Travis Kelce defends Taylor Swift amid backlash over ‚Äòshowgirl‚Äô marketing
content: Taylor Swift's 38 album variants for 'The Life of a Showgirl' spark debate, with some calling her marketing 'exploitative' despite her business genius.  Limited editions create urgency, driving resale markets.  While Swift earns through music, critics question if she sells authenticity or aspiration from her 'gilded fortress,' prompting fans to consider their purchasing habits.

title: Ayesha Curry quietly shows love for Stephen Curry amid recent backlash
content: Despite recent fan backlash over her personal comments, Ayesha Curry showed unwavering support for husband Stephen Curry after a Warriors loss. She shared a team cheer and presented him with custom cakes, highlighting their enduring bond. The couple remains focused on their family amidst public scrutiny, with Ayesha's past podcast remarks continuing to fuel debate.

title: Carter Hart delivers strong message to Mitch Marner and the Golden Knights
content: Carter Hart is making an NHL comeback with the Vegas Golden Knights on a professional tryout contract. After a hiatus, the 27-year-old goaltender is eager to prove himself, having learned and grown from past experiences.  Vegas aims to bolster their goaltending with Hart, who will be eligible to play from December 1st, potentially debuting soon after.

title: TN weather: Heavy rains trigger landslides; train services on Nilgiri Mountain Railway cancelled
content: Due to relentless downpours, the Nilgiri Mountain Railway has halted operations as debris has obstructed the tracks. Compounding this issue, an emerging low-pressure system in the Bay of Bengal is forecasted to strengthen, leading to fishing advisories being issued along Tamil Nadu's shores.

title: Watch: Vande Bharat pantry staff fight with dustbins, belts in Delhi
content: A heated argument between pantry assistants on the Khajuraho Vande Bharat Express at Hazrat Nizamuddin station escalated into a physical scuffle, captured in a viral video. Police have registered a case, and four employees were taken into custody. Their identity cards were deactivated, and the service provider faces contract termination and a hefty fine.

title: Green ‚Äòbachchon ka‚Äô, banned crackers ‚Äòbadon ka‚Äô; buyers snap up illegal stock in Delhi-NCR
content: Despite the legal sale of green firecrackers commencing, conventional, polluting varieties were freely available across Delhi-NCR markets, flouting Supreme Court orders. Sellers employed code words and hid banned items, while fake QR codes adorned many products. Authorities deployed inspection teams, but illegal sales persisted, impacting licensed traders.

title: '25,000 Americans would've died': Video shows moment US struck 'drug-carrying' submarine - Watch
content: US forces destroyed a large drug-carrying submarine en route to the United States, preventing an estimated 25,000 potential overdose deaths. Two suspected traffickers were returned to Ecuador and Colombia for prosecution, while two others were killed in the strike. This action is part of a broader campaign against drug trafficking from Latin America.

title: Inside Vance‚Äôs Marine past: From an Iraq recruit to flexing military power in California
content: Vice President JD Vance marked the US semiquincentennial with a powerful military demonstration at Camp Pendleton, showcasing Marine strength amid a government shutdown. The event, which drew protesters and criticism from Governor Newsom, highlighted Vance's return to his military roots and his use of military symbolism to project federal resolve and appeal to voters.

title: 'Tech issue': Air India Milan‚ÄìDelhi flight cancelled after snag; 250 passengers stranded
content: Hundreds of Diwali travelers faced disruptions as an Air India Dreamliner's technical snag at Milan airport led to the cancellation of flight AI138 to Delhi on Friday. Most of the 250 passengers have been rebooked for October 20, coinciding with the festival, with the airline providing hotel accommodations and ground assistance.

title: Travis Kelce's status vs Raiders: Injury update ahead of today's game
content: Kansas City Chiefs tight end Travis Kelce is expected to play against the Las Vegas Raiders in Week 7. Despite lingering ankle soreness, Kelce leads the team in receiving yards and has a history of dominating the Raiders. A betting model predicts he will exceed receiving yard and reception props, highlighting his continued impact.

title: ‚ÄòNo Kings‚Äô protests sweep US: Why are millions marching against Trump?
content: Millions across the US participated in "No Kings" protests, advocating for democracy and opposing perceived authoritarian tendencies. Demonstrators emphasized citizenship, free speech, and civic responsibility, connecting current actions to a legacy of grassroots activism. The movement highlights widespread public concern over the nation's direction and the protection of democratic principles.

title: Dragon-like millipede discovered in Thailand‚Äôs Pha Daeng cave
content: Scientists exploring northern Thailand's Pha Daeng Cave have discovered a new millipede species, Desmoxytes chaofa, or the Princess Dragon Millipede. This tiny, dragon-like creature, distinguished by its spiky body and delicate legs, was found in the cave's unique karst ecosystem. The discovery highlights the importance of protecting hidden cave environments and their undiscovered biodiversity.

title: Viral on Instagram: This Trump vs Xi Jinping Dragon Ball-Z style fight will break your mind
content: Meme culture churns at dizzying speed, blurring the lines between what‚Äôs real and what‚Äôs fake. Among the chaos, one clip has captured the internet‚Äôs attention: Donald Trump and Xi Jinping facing off in a Dragon Ball‚Äìstyle anime battle, and of all the absurd ideas out there, this one is truly special.

title: 'Sab kuch luta ke ...' : J&K CM demands removal of PSA; Owaisi takes poetic jibe
content: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi criticized Jammu and Kashmir CM Omar Abdullah's demand for statehood to repeal the controversial Public Safety Act. Owaisi highlighted the law's historical misuse by various governments, leading to widespread human rights violations and detentions without trial for thousands since 1978.

title: IND vs AUS: Rohit and Shubman caught munching popcorn during rain delay - watch
content: Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's return to the ODI arena in Perth saw a disappointing batting performance, with the duo, along with Shubman Gill, scoring a combined 18 runs. Amidst a rain delay, Rohit and Gill shared a lighthearted moment enjoying popcorn, highlighting camaraderie despite the challenging match.

title: Bihar polls: Ex-RJD candidate denied ticket over Rs 2.7cr demand; alleges injustice
content: Former RJD candidate Madan Shah alleged he was promised a ticket for the 2025 Bihar Assembly Elections by Lalu Prasad Yadav. Shah claims RJD leader Sanjay Yadav demanded Rs 2.7 crore, and when he refused, the ticket was given to another candidate. This comes as campaign activities intensify for the upcoming Bihar elections.

title: SGBs offering 153% return! RBI announces redemption dates for this series
content: Sovereign Gold Bond 2020-21 Series-VII holders can now redeem their investments early, with the RBI setting the redemption price at Rs 12,792 per unit. This offers investors an impressive return of over 150% on their initial Rs 5,051 per gram investment. The early redemption option becomes available after five years from the issue date.

title: Delhi shocker: Pregnant woman stabbed to death by former live-in partner; husband kills attacker
content: In a tragic turn of events in Nabi Karim, Delhi, a pregnant woman lost her life after being stabbed by her ex-partner. Her husband, who suffered injuries in the altercation, fought back, resulting in the attacker‚Äôs demise. This shocking incident, rooted in a complicated relationship history, unfolded in plain sight, leaving the community in disbelief.

title: Karur stampede fallout: TVK pays Rs 20L to victims‚Äô families; Vijay asks people to skip Diwali
content: In the wake of the devastating stampede in Karur, the TVK has stepped forward, offering ‚Çπ20 lakh to each of the 41 families affected, alongside the state government's provision of ‚Çπ10 lakh. Actor Vijay has called upon party members to skip Diwali festivities out of respect for the victims.

title: 'Operation Move Earth': How ousted Syrian leader Assad relocated a mass grave; what was the purpose?
content: Syrian government secretly moved thousands of bodies from a mass grave in Qutayfah to a hidden desert location between 2019 and 2021.  Dubbed 'Operation Move Earth,' the clandestine effort involved nightly truck convoys to conceal evidence of alleged mass killings and crimes. This operation, uncovered by Reuters, highlights the ongoing crisis of missing persons in Syria.

title: 'Why spend money on diyas': Akhilesh Yadav questions Deepotsav spending; BJP hits back
content: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav's criticism of the government's expenditure on diyas for Ayodhya's Deepotsav sparked a political row, with the BJP accusing the SP of opposing Hindu sentiments. Meanwhile, Ayodhya is preparing for its ninth Deepotsav, aiming for a Guinness World Record by lighting over 31 lakh diyas.

title: Post-Diwali smog alert: After crackers and light, Delhi AQI may breach ‚Äòsevere‚Äô mark
content: Delhi's air quality is set to plummet to 'severe' levels post-Diwali, with firecracker emissions expected to be the primary culprit. While stubble burning's impact may be reduced, experts warn that exceeding permitted firecracker timings could drastically worsen pollution.  Strong winds later on Tuesday might offer some relief, but health concerns remain high.

title: Betrayal and bloodshed: Love triangle turns deadly; 2 killed, 1 critical in knife attack
content: A love triangle turned deadly in Delhi's Nabi Karim, leaving two dead. Aashu, a former live-in partner, fatally stabbed his ex-girlfriend Shalini and himself after a confrontation with her husband, Aakash. Aakash, injured, fought for his life and is now central to the police investigation into the tragic events.

title: IND vs AUS: A unique first for Virat Kohli in Australia; India in trouble
content: Cricket fans welcomed the return of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli after a long break, but the ODI series opener against Australia saw a disappointing start.  Both batsmen were dismissed cheaply, contributing to the lowest aggregate runs for the trio in an ODI.  Rohit's milestone 500th match also began with an underwhelming score.

title: Bigg Boss 19: Daboo Malik appears on WKV; says 'he's proud of his son'
content: Daboo Malik appeared on Bigg Boss 19 to address his son Amaal's controversial remarks. He urged Amaal to play with dignity and self-control, emphasizing the importance of respecting women. Amaal broke down and promised to improve, with Salman Khan also advising him to control his speech.

title: Missing Deaf-Mute Hindu Minor Girl Surfaces In Pak, Married To Older Man
content: A 15-year-old Hindu girl, born deaf and mute, who was missing for over a week, has surfaced before the media in Pakistan's Sindh province, holding a certificate of conversion to Islam after allegedly marrying a much older Muslim man.

title: An Extramarital Affair, Pregnancy, Then Double Murder In Delhi
content: A dispute over an extramarital affair has left two people dead in central Delhi. In the horrifying incident, a pregnant woman was stabbed to death by her lover in public view in the Ram Nagar area, while her husband managed to kill him.

title: India Doesn't Seek To Dominate World But Be Centre Of Stability: Top Official
content: India does not seek to dominate the world but serve as a power centre of stability, sustainability and spirituality, said Ministry of Information and Broadcasting (I&B) Secretary Sanjay Jaju said.

title: India's 1st Indigenous Antibiotic Is Effective Against Respiratory Infections: Minister
content: Union Minister Dr Jitendra Singh, on Saturday said India has developed its first indigenously discovered antibiotic 'Nafithromycin', which is effective against resistant respiratory infections.

title: Akhilesh Yadav Asks "Why Spend On Lamps" During Diwali, BJP Responds
content: The Samajwadi Party chief's comment came as Ayodhya is eyeing to create history by lighting over 26 lakh diyas to celebrate Diwali.

title: No Commercial Activities In Playgrounds Of Schools, Colleges: UP Court
content: TheAllahabadHigh Court has held that immovable propertiesbelonging to educational institutions in Uttar Pradesh includingplaygroundscannotbeallowed tobeusedforanycommercialactivities.

title: "Break Daughter's Legs If She Visits Non-Hindus": Pragya Thakur's Shocker
content: A controversy has erupted over former Bhopal MP Pragya Singh Thakur's remarks that parents should refrain their daughters from visiting the houses of "non-Hindus" and "break their legs" if they disobey.

title: Family First: Dynasts Dominate Bihar Poll Lists As Parties Field Political Heirs
content: Dynasts continue to dominate Bihar's political landscape, with a considerable number of candidates being either sons, daughters, wives or close relatives of established politicians.

title: Samosa Vendor Thrashes Man As Online Payment Fails, Snatches His Smartwatch In Madhya Pradesh
content: A young passenger, after purchasing samosas from the vendor, attempted to pay digitally. However, due to a network issue, the payment did not go through.

title: Samosa Vendor Thrashes Man As Online Payment Fails, Snatches His Smartwatch In Madhya Pradesh
content: A young passenger, after purchasing samosas from the vendor, attempted to pay digitally. However, due to a network issue, the payment did not go through.

title: Giriraj Singh's 'Namak Haraam' Remark On Muslims Sparks Row
content: Union minister Giriraj Singh has once again courted controversy by making a scathing remark against a minority community, saying that he doesn't need the votes of 'namak haraams' (betrayers).

title: Surat Teen Assaults Cops Over Liquor Seizure, Businessman Father Arrested
content: Two people, including a prominent businessman, were arrested after liquor cans were recovered from a vehicle near a hotel, where a huge party was held to celebrate his birthday, in Surat in the dry state of Gujarat earlier this week.

title: Opinion: Opinion | India, Taliban And Pakistan: An Uneasy Geostrategic Dance
content: Geographically and strategically, amicable ties between Afghanistan and India have long been a source of unease for Pakistan.

title: How Easy Is It To Buy Electric Car? What ChargeZone CEO Said At NDTV World Summit
content: If 30 per cent of vehicles on Indian roads are electric by 2030, the country could save $80-90 billion in foreign exchange, funds that could support education and healthcare, ChargeZone CEO Kartikey Hariyani has said.

title: Court Allows RSS's March In Priyank Kharge's Turf, But On November 2
content: In a setback to the Congress-led government in Karnataka, the High Court on Sunday allowed the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) to hold its route march in Chittapur on November 2.

title: Dearness Allowance, Tax Waivers: What Andhra Government Staff Get This Diwali
content: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu has announced a set of benefits for government employees as part of the Diwali bonanza, including release of one Dearness Allowance from November 1.

title: Jain Community Drives Home 186 Luxury Cars With Rs 21 Crore Discount
content: The Jain community, known for its business legacy, has clinched discounts worth a whopping Rs 21 crore while driving home 186 high-end luxury cars like BMW, Audi, and Mercedes, showcasing the community's formidable purchasing power.

title: Railway Gears Up For Festive Rush, To Run 1,702 Special Trains On Diwali, Chhath
content: Central Railway will operate 1,702 special trains for the Diwali and Chhath Puja festivals in an effort to help passengers travel to their destinations and join their families on the festival.

title: Pushpam Priya: The Emerging Bihar Leader Who Wears Only Black And A Mask
content: Back from the United Kingdom, Pushpam Priya Chaudhary aspires to bring a big change in the traditional political landscape of Bihar.

title: Avoid Company Of 'Sanatanis', Remain Cautious Of RSS: Siddaramaiah
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah on Saturday urged people to avoid the company of 'sanatanis' and remain cautious of the RSS and Sangh Parivar, saying they had historically opposed B R Ambedkar and the Constitution he framed.

title: LaMelo playing 70+ games and other bold predictions for 2025-26
content: our fantasy basketball experts tasked them with detailing their boldest predictions for 2025-26 . he's currently 85th on average in ESPN live drafts, and his ability to create offense for others is only growing . Miller's coaching staff already trust him to find his own shot .

title: Projecting the CFP top 12 after Week 8: Big move for Bama
content: the 13 members of the college football playoff selection committee will meet for two days . they're going to meet at the Gaylord Texan Resort in Grapevine, Texas . the committee will do their own mock ranking to help the new members better understand the process .

title: Vanderbilt poking fun at LSU headlines Week 8 college football trolls
content: the trolls came out in week 8 of the college football season . the Commodores defeated no. 10 LSU 31-24 on saturday . quarterback Diego Pavia accounted for 246 yards and three touchdowns .

title: NHL Power Rankings: Canes on top, one futures bet for each team
content: a panel of ESPN hockey commentators, analysts, reporters and editors send in a 1-32 poll based on the games through Wednesday . previous ranking: 2 Points percentage: 100% Hurricanes win the Stanley Cup (+800). the first two games showcased Carolina's depth .

title: The vibes are unusually high for the Giants: 'When you have that kind of spark ... it raises everyone's level'
content: new: "the energy is there," tight end says of the team atmosphere . "Get Up" is the result of winning two of three games since rookie Jaxson Dart became the starting quarterback . it's the ultimatum for the Giants to win a game against the Eagles .

title: Bontemps and Windhorst: The latest intel on the Lakers, Knicks, Rockets and more
content: the deadline for extensions for most eligible players is Monday at 6 p.m. ET . there's a lot of pessimism right now, even by normal standards . a star-studded free agent class in the summer of 2027 could all be available .

title: Best of Week 8: The SEC runs through Alabama, Georgia and ... Vanderbilt?!
content: there are 16 teams in the SEC, and nearly every one is aiming for the playoff or considering a coaching change . only Kentucky contractually obligated to move on to basketball season by the end of October . this weekend, there were more SEC games than ever .

title: Postecoglou's coaching stint at Forest was short, but not Premier League's shortest
content: ange Postecoglou has been sacked by Nottingham Forest after just 39 days and five premier league matches in charge . he took over on september 9, making him the 10th permanent manager to last less than 100 days as a permanent manager during the era . sportsmail look at the managers who failed to make a positive impact in the early days of their reign .

title: Dragunov returns, Rhodes DQ, more
content: Ilja Dragunov defeated Sami Zayn to become the new champion . this week's "SmackDown" felt more like a valley compared to last week . impromptu Undisputed title match broke out after Jacob Fatu was attacked backstage .

title: DRI seizes ‚Çπ5 crore worth Chinese firecrackers in Thoothukudi; four arrested
content: The restricted firecrackers had been smuggled into the country under the guise of engineering tools and carts

title: Ancient Indians propagated culture, didn't conquer or convert: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat contrasted ancient Indians‚Äô goodwill with invaders who looted India and weakened it by ‚Äúlooting the minds‚Äù of its people

title: Nobody is 100% happy over appointment of new functionaries, admits KPCC president
content: Asked what steps were being taken to pacify such leaders, KPCC president Joseph said it need not be discussed with the media

title: MUTA condemns Private Universities Amendment Bill passed in Tamil Nadu Assembly
content: ‚ÄúThe amendment would equally reverse the respectful treatment rendered to the teachers and employees in government and government-aided colleges,‚Äù MUTA statement said ¬†

title: Heavy rains in the Nilgiris lead to landslips, traffic blocks
content: Heavy rains trigger landslips in Nilgiris, prompting swift response from officials and deployment of TNDRF personnel

title: A month on, Assam mourns Zubeen Garg‚Äôs death as family, fans await answers on his final moments
content: Hundreds thronged Garg's cremation site at Sonapur, on the outskirts of Guwahati, since October 19 morning, paying tributes to their beloved singer-composer

title: Woman run over by Omni bus near Koyambedu
content: Tragic accident in Arumbakkam results in the death of a 33-year-old woman after being hit by an omni bus

title: BJP slams denial of permission for RSS route march in Chittapur
content: In a post on X, B.Y. Vijayendra alleges that constitutional rights were being ‚Äúsnatched away in the name of the Constitution itself‚Äù

title: Kerala to finally ink PM SHRI despite CPI opposition
content: No need to lose out on Central funds, says Minister; points out that Higher Education and other departments too have done the same

title: LDF ‚Äòdivided‚Äô over Kerala Government‚Äôs move in seeking PM SHRI funds tied to NEP
content: General Education Minister Sivankutty said Kerala could ill afford to lose the ‚Çπ1,446 crore the Centre owed the State under the PM SHRI scheme

title: Special trains between Visakhapatnam-Parvathipuram
content: Train no. 08501 Visakhapatnam-Parvathipuram Special Express will leave Visakhapatnam at 10 a.m. from October 18 to 27

title: Two Mumbai airport cleaning staff held for smuggling ‚Çπ1.6 crore foreign gold
content: In total, 1.2 kg of gold dust of 24-karat purity, valued at around ‚Çπ1.6 crore, was seized under the Customs Act, the official added

title: Train services on K-K line hit owing to boulder fall between Tyda-Chimidapalli of Waltair Division
content: The railway authorities immediately rushed to the site and commenced restoration works on a war footing

title: Efforts to pacify Sudhakaran fail; veteran CPI(M) leader to skip KSKTU event
content: The veteran CPI(M) leader said the organisers could go ahead with the programme on their own and that his presence was not necessary

title: Government committed to help flood-hit farmers, won't let their Diwali be dark: Shinde
content: Maharashtra Deputy CM Eknath Shinde vows to support flood-affected farmers and dismisses alliance rumours

title: RSS march in Chittapur: permission denied over law and order concerns
content: Police warn of possible clashes as Bhim Army, Dalit Panthers also seek to hold processions on same route

title: Sovan Chatterjee‚Äôs new Kolkata civic body post after 7 years reignites talk of Trinamool truce
content: This official post back in Sovan Chatterjee‚Äôs second stint with the TMC as the chairman of NKDA has been observed by many as a soft launch back into the ruling party in West Bengal

title: Kerala braces for potential flooding, strong winds as Northeast monsoon intensifies
content: The IMD has forecast heavy to very heavy rains in North Kerala.¬†It has put Malappuram, Kozhikode, Kannur and Kasaragod under an orange alert

title: Centre extends deadline for filing GSTR-3B return till October 25
content: GSTR-3B is a monthly and quarterly summary return that registered taxpayers file in a staggered manner between the 20th, 22nd and 24th of every month for different categories of taxpayers

title: Huge number of devotees to Hasanamba festival: Hassan SP writes to DC, warns of stampedes if failed to restrict visitors
content: In her letter, dated October 17, the SP said a large number of people had been visiting the temple for the deity‚Äôs darshana. Even the queues meant for those who purchased tickets worth ‚Çπ1,000 and ‚Çπ300 had been several kilometres long

title: News in Frames: A festival woven in flowers
content: At the start of winter, the women of Telangana celebrate Bathukamma, paying floral tributes to Mother Nature; the festival fills the season with colour, song, and devotion

title: West Bengal Government appoints task force for flood reconstruction work in North Bengal
content: Darjeeling MP Raju Bista claimed that his convoy was attacked in Darjeeling district on Saturday. Stones were thrown on his convoy and one vehicle of the MPs convoy suffered minor damage

title: Bihar Election LIVE: PM Modi to launch campaign on October 24 with two back-to-back rallies
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will launch his campaign for the Bihar Assembly polls next week, with as many as four election rallies scheduled by the end of this month.

title: Ex-Uttarakhand CM Harish Rawat escapes unhurt after car meets with accident in Meerut
content: A man suddenly came in front of a police escort vehicle, forcing it to apply the brake, due to which the vehicles following it rammed into each other, including the Chief Minister‚Äôs car, said the official

title: Nirav Modi claims ‚Äòsensational developments‚Äô to come in U.K. extradition case
content: The fugitive diamantaire faces extradition to India for fraud and money laundering charges after six years in U.K. prison

title: Chandrayaan-2 makes first ever observation of Sun's impact on Moon, says ISRO
content: The opportunity to directly observe the effects of the CME impacting on the Moon came on May 10, 2024, when a series of CMEs were hurled by the Sun.

title: Lokesh to undertake six-day tour to Australia from October 19
content: The visit aims to study advanced teaching methodologies, strengthen educational and industrial collaborations, and promote the CII Partnership Summit 2025, scheduled to be held in Visakhapatnam

title: T.N.‚Äôs first BRTS integrated elevated corridor proposed on GST Road, from Kilambakkam to Mahindra World City
content: The proposed 18.4 km elevated corridor with BRTS provision on GST Road is an NHAI project to ease traffic in Chennai

title: A joyous¬†Deepavali for firecracker manufacturers in Sivakasi
content: The Supreme Court‚Äôs judgment permitting bursting of fireworks in¬†Delhi-NCR during¬†Deepavali after years has brought mixed emotions to the core. While environment activists are concerned about the implications, on this side of the¬†Vindhyas, it has brought cheer and hope to the fireworks makers of¬†Sivakasi. S. Sundar visits the town to learn more

title: Karnataka‚Äôs mutual fund assets touch 5.67 lakh crore
content: State has witnessed a 5X growth in mutual funds over the last decade, while Bengaluru alone has experienced an impressive 10X growth in the same period, underscoring the city‚Äôs significance as a key hub for economic activity: Quantum AMC

title: How are India-Taliban relations changing? | Explained
content: Is India‚Äôs Afghanistan policy changing? What did the Muttaqi visit achieve? With India deciding to reopen its embassy in Kabul, is it inching closer to recognising a Taliban-led government? Did the restrictions imposed on women by the Taliban come up during talks?

title: Bhopal-based journalists released by Rajasthan Police, day after detention for ‚Äòfake reports‚Äô on Diya Kumari and ‚Äòdemanding money‚Äô
content: A spokesperson at ‚ÄòThe Sootr‚Äô said that the duo was released around 6 p.m. and ‚Äúnothing concrete was found to prove the reports false‚Äù

title: West Bengal government seeks urgent repatriation of 11 migrant workers stranded in Oman
content: These migrant workers from Murshidabad, who had gone to work in Oman roughly 11 months back, were allegedly deceived by the recruiting agency and were left stranded without recourse

title: Bihar Assembly sat for average 29 days each year: ADR report
content: The report also showed 251 MLAs asked a total of 22,505 questions.; BJP MLA Arun Shankar Prasad asked the highest number of 275 questions, followed by Manohar Prasad Singh of the Congress, who posed 231 questions

title: Prashant Kishor: From backroom to ballot
content: The former political strategist, whose Jan Suraaj Party is contesting the coming Assembly elections in Bihar, seeks to disrupt the existing bipolar equations of the State and emerge as a new force

title: GCC increases relief centres to 215 in view of heavy rain forecast for Oct. 22
content: Private marriage halls, private schools and buildings being converted to relief centres across the city as heavy rains expected this monsoon

title: T.N. govt. doctors body urges Chief Minister to fulfil promises this Deepavali
content: The body says just allocating ‚Çπ25 crore per month would resolve the salary issue, calling it an investment in public health

title: Eight killed, 15 injured as mini truck falls into 200-ft gorge in Maharashtra
content: The vehicle with about 40 persons on board was returning from a pilgrimage site when its driver lost control of the vehicle, an official said. The driver has been booked for negligent and rash driving.

title: I know contractors‚Äô pain, but no one can threaten the government: D.K. Shivakumar
content: On Friday, the Karnataka State Contractors Association warned that it would release a ‚Äúcorruption report card‚Äù on the State government in December if the pending amount of ‚Çπ33,000 crore from the past two years is not cleared within a month.¬†

title: Congress, BJP candidates file nominations for Nuapada bypoll in Odisha
content: The BJP is fielding Jay Dholakia, son of BJD MLA Rajendra Dholakia whose death left the Assembly seat vacant. Congress‚Äôs Ghasiram Majhi who contested the last year‚Äôs Assembly polls as an Independent candidate had finished second.

title: Smriti Parade to be organised at APSP 6th Battalion on October 21
content: Police Department lines up several programmes from October 21 to 30 to pay tributes to personnel who died in line of duty

title: ‚ÄòWe will stand by you‚Äô: Vijay‚Äôs TVK extends ‚Çπ20 lakh aid to Karur stampede victim‚Äôs family
content: TVK had earlier announced financial¬†assistance to the families of those who lost their lives in the Karur stampede

title: City hospital completes 200 POEM procedures for patients suffering from Achalasia Cardia
content: It is a rare condition that affects approximately 10 in every 1 lakh individuals, and  causes difficulty in swallowing, chest pain, and regurgitation of food

title: Infopark‚Äôs fourth phase development expected to generate 50,000 jobs: CM
content: Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan announces fourth phase development of Infopark to create 50,000 jobs and attract ‚Çπ3,000 crore investment

title: No formal consultations made by Centre so far, says Omar Abdullah about J&K Statehood
content: The Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister disputes the Centre‚Äôs claim made before the Supreme Court that it was engaged in talks with the NC government in the Union Territory

title: YSRCP running fake campaigns on liquor to mislead people, says I&PR Minister Parthasarathy
content: It is the YSRCP that has encouraged a few individuals to resort to liquor adulteration in Mulakalacheruvu mandal, he says

title: CPI(M) MP A.A. Rahim urges SBI to withdraw remittance limit for Indian expatriates in Maldives
content: In a letter to the SBI Chairman, Mr. Rahim says many Indian citizens residing in Maldives were currently facing serious difficulties, following the recent restrictions imposed by the bank‚Äôs Maldives branches

title: Bengaluru Traffic Police introduces e-accident report feature on its app
content: This new feature enables motorists to digitally report minor accidents and instantly receive an acknowledgement faster to help them get insurance and damage claims , eliminating the need for in-person visits to traffic police stations.

title: Thiruvananthapuram sees a hike in meningoencephalitis cases
content: Of the 13 cases reported from Thursday to Saturday, 12 are from the district. Source of infection remains unclear in most cases. Most cases do not have the history of exposure to waterbodies

title: J&K Congress starts district-wise hunger strike over Statehood demand
content: People are feeling neglected in absence of Statehood as their rights have been denied and compromised, says J&K Pradesh Congress Committee (JKPCC) president Tariq Hameed Karra

title: A.P. CM announces DA, other benefits for govt. employees ahead of Deepavali

title: RWAs restricting entry to enumerators slowing down caste survey in GBA area: officials
content: Corporation commissioners in the GBA area and senior officials are scheduled to submit a report to Chief Minister Siddaramaiah on Sunday

content: Jairam Ramesh, the former Environment Minister, further said the court‚Äôs observation that the FRA does not interfere with State rights over mines or minerals beneath forest land is ‚Äúa strange perversion of logic and justice.‚Äù

title: Don't repose trust in 'jungle raj wearing a new mask': Amit Shah
content: ‚ÄúKisan Samman Nidhi has been given to 87 lakh farmers, while 52 lakh have benefited from the crop insurance scheme. title: Delay in adoption deprives the child of formative experiences and opportunities, says Madras High Court

title: Seasoned tourists in Bengal headed for nearby hills despite recent calamities
